greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of primes contained as binary substrings in binary representation of n, counted with repetitions.
example: n=7 -> '111' contains 3 binary substrings which are primes: '11' (11b), '11' (b11) and '111' itself, therefore a(7)=2.
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Dec 08 2002
